newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Sri Lanka rupee ends lower vs dollar.
newsitem.headline: Sri Lanka rupee ends lower vs dollar.

text.p: The Sri Lankan rupee closed weaker against the dollar at 55.78 on Friday after opening at 55.72 following the central bank's quotation of the exchange rate in favour of the U.S. unit, dealers said.
The Central Bank fixed buying and selling prices at 55.3658 and 56.4843 respectively, pushing up the dollar by 3.5 cents each.
Though the dollar was easier on international markets, the Central Bank's stand on the dollar kept it bouyant locally, dealers said.
"Commercially there is not much demand for dollars," a Commercial Bank dealer said. "There has been very little trading over the past few days."
Overnight call money, which opened at 15 percent, closed at 14.5 percent with the market well supplied, dealers said.
